page.title: 09HISTORY-BACONSTHORPE CASTLE
page.content: THIS WAS BUILT BY THE BACON FAMILY FROM{1450-1486}TO END OFF A HUGE SHEEP RUN STRETCHING ACROSS NORFOLK. THE FAMILY ALSO GAVE THEIR NAME TO THE VILLAGE, BACON'S_THORPE. ITS A QUADRANGULAR BUILDING SURROUNDED BY A DEEP MOAT. THE REMAINING WALLS ARE STILL A CERTAIN HEIGHT AS THE TOWERS ONE OF WHICH IS MADE TO LET WATER THROUGH TO FORM A DRINKING POINT FOR ANIMALS. MUCH OF THE 3--STOREYED GATEHOUSE REMAINS. NEARBY ARE THE REMAINS OF A LARGE SYMMETRICAL LIVING HOUSE WITH MULLIONED AND TRANSOMED WINDOWS. FURTHER OUTSIDE WAS A GATE HOUSE WITH OCTAGONAL TOWERS. BY {A.STEVENS,B.SHRIVE,T.HOSKING
